content:

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Audit Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Qualifications

title: Construction Engineer Job at Jaza Energy
content:
Jaza is a solar energy start-up working to power Sub-Saharan Africa. We build solar-powered shops which charge batteries customers use to power their homes. In 2022, we achieved over 1.5 million battery swaps, providing approximately 186,000 people access to clean, affordable energy. We employ women from each community (known as Jaza Stars) to run the service, empowering our team to become leaders, entrepreneurs and drivers of economic growth within their communities. We’ve already successfully entered the Nigerian market, piloted several sites here and will grow to hundreds of locations over the next year. To support this expansion, we’re planning to hire over 200 people over the next 6 months.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Construction Engineer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Job Function: Expansion
Designation: Acquisition Team Lead
Employment Type: Contract
Workplace Type: Onsite

Job Role
The Expansion Construction Engineer is the owner of the process of service location acquisition, renovations and installation in our expansion process into new sites. The Expansion Construction person finds suitable service locations, negotiates, leases, procure equipment, renovates, installs, audits and signs off on those allocated sites according to our company’s predefined standards.


	Assess approved sites and identify suitable services locations, shops / plots of land for leasing that meet our defined standards.
	Manage the lease or acquisition of shops or plot of land that meet our service location criteria.
	Assess the acquired service location and identify preparations or renovations requirements.
	Manage the sourcing of appropriate furniture producing factories/contractors that meet the set criteria to produce Jaza furniture and install hubs across allocated sites.
	Manage quality checklists and ensure that they are adhered to in the process of acquisition, renovation and construction.
	Work effectively with engineers, supply chain, and other construction teams, ensuring seamless integration between different parts of the project.
	Request, procure, take delivery and document required items, tools and equipment needed for the completion of the work.
	Ensure availability of furniture across allocated regions/sites undergoing Expansion to ensure there are no delays in the set timelines.
	Monitor renovations and construction needs and constantly reports need for tools, materials and equipment with reference to the set targets across allocated locations undergoing Expansion
	Document and report milestones reached during this process.


Qualifications


	A relevant Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years hands-on experience in similar role.
	Understanding of the overall construction process, including shop or land negotiation, leasing and acquisition, renovation, site preparation, furnishing and foundation work, and structural assembly.
	Ability to interpret blueprints and design specifications, especially for our customized hubs, ensuring they meet both the structural and electrical needs for solar installations.
	Ability to think critically and come up with solutions for unique or complex construction challenges, particularly when working with already built shops.
	Good data collection, analytical, and reporting skills.
	Ability to commit to high level quality standards.
	Clear communication skills to interact with suppliers, contractors, and other stakeholders and explain complex technical concepts in simple terms.
	Ability to work independently, interact with people of different backgrounds, cultures, languages and to travel frequently to remote locations.


Must have skills:


	construction
	Communication
	land / Site Purchase
	Construction Management

title: Quality Assurance Officer Job at ReelFruit
content:
ReelFruit, founded in 2012, is the market leader in the healthy snack category, pioneering the introduction of healthy dried fruit as a snack in the Nigerian market. The company was founded on a mission to build a scalable agribusiness to add value to raw materials locally and produce, package and distribute locally made snacks that could sit on any shelf in the world!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Duties and Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure compliance to quality policy, procedures, work instructions, and documented quality systems. In addition, ensure compliance to statutory and regulatory requirements.
	Carry out inspection upon arrival of raw materials, packaging materials and inputs against specifications and submit reports after inspection.
	Ensure all quality procedures for fruit washing and storage are observed.
	Check the peeling and cutting quality, and complete the quality control sheet at Processing.
	Check the packing quality and complete the quality control sheet at Packing.
	Conduct quality control on pallets in accordance to the finished goods control procedure.
	Ensure daily calibration and verification of all measuring equipment in the laboratory and in the factory.
	Monitor and control all storage areas and conditions.
	Continuous training and coaching of factory employees on Food safety and quality issues.
	Fulfillment of housekeeping and environmental standards.
	Report any non-compliance detected in relation to both the Quality and Food safety management system to the Quality manager.
	Report immediately any non-conformity on product quality detected to the QA manager.
	Report immediately any breakage, damage or malfunction of equipment to the QA manager.
	Ensure samples for analyses are properly taken for each batch.
	Manage and maintain all tools and equipment for carrying out quality control checks: in the laboratory and in the factory.
	Ensure proper and prompt filing of records: maintain organized and accessible records for analysis and reference.
	Ensure correct traceability of products and records.
	Supporting process improvements throughout the testing and quality assurance processes
	Adhere to all health and safety guidelines in the factory.


Supervisory duties:


	Appraise the performance of immediate team members, identify their training needs and organize or recommend appropriate training for them.
	Administer disciplinary measures of immediate team members in accordance with the company’s disciplinary procedures
	Interpret policies and procedures to immediate team members and where necessary, consult superior or appropriate departments.


Educational Qualifications, Experience & Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree / HND or higher in Food Science, Agribusiness or a related field.
	At least two (2) years of professional or sector / industry experience.
	Flexibility based on factory production schedule.
	Knowledge of the use of measuring equipment.
	Knowledge of GMPs
	Knowledge of the HACCP system
	Excellent planning, analytical and organizational skills
	Ability to work with little or no supervision.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Applications.
	Integrity and accountability
	Fluency in English – excellent communication skills, both oral and written.
